title: Ultrabornological space
summary: In functional analysis, a topological vector space (TVS) X {\displaystyle X} is called ultrabornological if every bounded linear operator from X {\displaystyle X} into another TVS is necessarily continuous. A general version of the closed graph theorem holds for ultrabornological spaces. Ultrabornological spaces were introduced by Alexander Grothendieck (Grothendieck [1955, p. 17] "espace du type (Î²)").[1]
